actor_awards.notes: Best known for his role as Plato in 'Rebel Without a Cause' (1955). One of the first major teen idols of the 1950s. Won a Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actor for 'Exodus' (1960). His career was tragically cut short when he was murdered at the age of 37.

filmography.title: Rebel Without a Cause
filmography.role_description: A troubled, sensitive teenager who looks up to James Dean's character as a father figure in this seminal drama about youth rebellion.
filmography.plot: A rebellious young man with a troubled past comes to a new town, finding friends and enemies.

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A young Jewish survivor of the Holocaust who joins the Irgun and fights for the founding of Israel.
filmography.plot: The state of Israel is founded in 1948 after a group of Jewish refugees are spirited out of British Mandate Palestine.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Giant
filmography.role_description: The son of a Mexican ranch hand who goes to war and returns a hero, only to face tragedy.
filmography.plot: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and associates.

filmography.title: Crime in the Streets
filmography.role_description: A young gang member involved in a plot to commit murder in this gritty urban drama.
filmography.plot: A social worker tries to turn a street gang leader away from a life of crime.

filmography.title: Somebody Up There Likes Me
filmography.role_description: The loyal best friend of boxer Rocky Graziano.
filmography.plot: Rocky Graziano is a young man who joins a street gang and goes to prison before finding redemption through boxing.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: A U.S. paratrooper who is killed early in the D-Day landings in this massive war epic.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography, Best Special Effects

filmography.title: Escape from the Planet of the Apes
filmography.role_description: One of the three intelligent apes who travel back in time to 20th-century Earth.
filmography.plot: The world is shocked by the appearance of three talking chimpanzees, who arrived mysteriously in a U.S. spacecraft.

filmography.title: The Gene Krupa Story
filmography.role_description: Mineo stars as the famous jazz drummer, showcasing his own drumming skills.
filmography.plot: The rise, fall, and redemption of the legendary jazz drummer Gene Krupa.

filmography.title: Cheyenne Autumn
filmography.role_description: A young Cheyenne warrior in John Ford's epic western about the tribe's journey home.
filmography.plot: The Cheyenne Indians decide to leave their reservation in Oklahoma and return to their ancestral home in Wyoming, pursued by the US Cavalry.

filmography.title: Tonka
filmography.role_description: A young Sioux brave who captures and trains a wild horse that becomes the sole survivor of Custer's Last Stand.
filmography.plot: A young Sioux Indian catches a wild horse and trains it, but the horse is later confiscated by the US Cavalry.

filmography.title: Six Bridges to Cross
filmography.role_description: Mineo's film debut, playing the younger version of Tony Curtis's character, a career criminal.
filmography.plot: A street smart delinquent rises to become a major crime boss, pursued by a cop who tries to reform him.

filmography.title: The Private War of Major Benson
filmography.role_description: A cadet leader at a military boarding school run by nuns.
filmography.plot: A tough Army major is threatened with discharge unless he can shape up the ROTC program at a Catholic boarding school.

filmography.title: Dino
filmography.role_description: A rebellious teenager released from a reformatory who struggles to adjust to life outside.
filmography.plot: A juvenile delinquent is released from a reformatory and struggles to resist the lure of his old life.

filmography.title: Rock, Pretty Baby
filmography.role_description: A member of a high school rock and roll band in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A teenager wants to become a musician against his father's wishes and forms a band to enter a contest.

filmography.title: The Young Don't Cry
filmography.role_description: A lonely teenager at a Georgia orphanage who becomes involved with an escaped convict.
filmography.plot: A teenager in an orphanage helps an escaped convict, hoping the man will take him away.

filmography.title: Who Killed Teddy Bear
filmography.role_description: A shy busboy who stalks a nightclub DJ in this gritty, cult neo-noir thriller.
filmography.plot: A disc jockey at a Times Square nightclub is stalked by an obscene caller.

filmography.title: Krakatoa, East of Java
filmography.role_description: The son of a pearl diver who joins a dangerous expedition to find a sunken treasure near the erupting volcano.
filmography.plot: A ship captain leads a group of divers and treasure hunters to retrieve a fortune in pearls from a shipwreck near the volcano Krakatoa.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: The Greatest Story Ever Told
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this all-star biblical epic retelling the life of Jesus.
filmography.plot: An all-star epic retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from the Nativity to the Resurrection.

filmography.title: 80 Steps to Jonah
filmography.role_description: A handyman at a school for blind children who befriends a fugitive.
filmography.plot: A man on the run from the police stumbles upon a school for blind children and finds redemption.

filmography.title: A Private's Affair
filmography.role_description: One of three young draftees who get mixed up in romance and a TV show appearance.
filmography.plot: Three draftees are groomed for a televised talent show but get into various romantic and comedic complications.

filmography.title: Escape from Zahrain
filmography.role_description: A student revolutionary who joins Yul Brynner's character in an escape across the desert.
filmography.plot: A nationalist leader escapes a prison van in a Middle Eastern country and flees across the desert with a group of fellow prisoners.

filmography.title: Columbo: A Case of Immunity
filmography.role_description: A diplomatic attaché involved in a murder plot in this notable TV movie appearance.
filmography.plot: The first secretary of the Suari legation murders the chief of security to cover up a theft and frames a dissident group.
